title.bibl: Onze Toekomst, May 4, 1927. [Debate on Moving Pictures]

div.bibl: Onze Toekomst, May 4, 1927. [DEBATE ON MOVING PICTURES]

body.p: The Junior Young Men's Society of the First Christian Reformed Church of Englewood met the senior society of the same church in a debate. The subject was: "Resolved, that Cinematography may be used by Christians". The Junior Society won by a vote of 2 to 1. The Junior Society was represented by P. De Vries and N. Stol; the Senior Society by B. Pastoor and J. Van Der Meer. The Reverend S. Westra, J. Rudinga, and G. Zeaman, were judges.
[Translator's note: The Dutch were opposed for a long period to movies.]
